segment.source: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: Sets the properties for the KMDF Verifier (or framework verifier) on a remote computer.
segment.target: Sets the properties for the KMDF Verifier (or framework verifier) on a remote computer.

segment.source: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a KMDF driver to a test computer.
segment.target: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a KMDF driver to a test computer.

segment.source: For information about KMDF drivers, see Kernel-Mode Driver Framework.
segment.target: For information about KMDF drivers, see Kernel-Mode Driver Framework.

segment.source: For more information about the framework verifier, see Using the Framework's Verifier and WDF Verifier Control Application.
segment.target: For more information about the framework verifier, see Using the Framework's Verifier and WDF Verifier Control Application.

segment.source: Setting KMDF Verifier properties for driver package projects
segment.target: Setting KMDF Verifier properties for driver package projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

segment.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click KMDF Verifier.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click KMDF Verifier.

segment.source: Click the Enable KMDF Verifier option and select KMDF verifier is always on.
segment.target: Click the Enable KMDF Verifier option and select KMDF verifier is always on.

segment.source: When this option is selected, you can configure the framework verification options for KMDF drivers.
segment.target: When this option is selected, you can configure the framework verification options for KMDF drivers.

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enable KMDF Verifier
segment.target: Enable KMDF Verifier

segment.source: Enables the KMDF verifier on the test computer.
segment.target: Enables the KMDF verifier on the test computer.

segment.source: The choices are KMDF verifier is always on or KMDF verifer is off.
segment.target: The choices are KMDF verifier is always on or KMDF verifer is off.

segment.source: If the KMDF verifier is not enabled, basic framework verification is enabled as part of Driver Verifier if KMDF version is 1.9 or higher.
segment.target: If the KMDF verifier is not enabled, basic framework verification is enabled as part of Driver Verifier if KMDF version is 1.9 or higher.

segment.source: KMDF Service Names
segment.target: KMDF Service Names

segment.source: Specifies the service names of the KDMF drivers to monitor.
segment.target: Specifies the service names of the KDMF drivers to monitor.

segment.source: IRQL checks
segment.target: IRQL checks

segment.source: Enables IRQL checks and critical memory leak checks.
segment.target: Enables IRQL checks and critical memory leak checks.

segment.source: Forward Compatible Checks
segment.target: Forward Compatible Checks

segment.source: Enables checks created after the current driver version.
segment.target: Enables checks created after the current driver version.

segment.source: Forward Progress Handler Testing
segment.target: Forward Progress Handler Testing

segment.source: Specifies options for testing forward progress handling of your driver.
segment.target: Specifies options for testing forward progress handling of your driver.

segment.source: No Allocation Failures No faults will be simulated to test the forward progress handling of your driver.
segment.target: No Allocation Failures No faults will be simulated to test the forward progress handling of your driver.

segment.source: Fail All Allocations All I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue will appear to fail, relying on your driver's forward progress handling.
segment.target: Fail All Allocations All I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue will appear to fail, relying on your driver's forward progress handling.

segment.source: Randomly Fail Allocations Randomly fail I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue.
segment.target: Randomly Fail Allocations Randomly fail I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue.

segment.source: Track KMDF Object Handles
segment.target: Track KMDF Object Handles

segment.source: Specifies the list of object handle types to track.
segment.target: Specifies the list of object handle types to track.

segment.source: Enable KMDF Loader Messages
segment.target: Enable KMDF Loader Messages

segment.source: Enables KMDF loader messages through the debugger.
segment.target: Enables KMDF loader messages through the debugger.

segment.source: A reboot of the target computer is required to enable this.
segment.target: A reboot of the target computer is required to enable this.

segment.source: Starting with Windows Vista, the operating system suppresses DbgPrint output by default, which makes the WDF Loader diagnostic messages unusable until the suppression is overridden.
segment.target: Starting with Windows Vista, the operating system suppresses DbgPrint output by default, which makes the WDF Loader diagnostic messages unusable until the suppression is overridden.

segment.source: KDMF Verifier can manage this for you so that KMDF loader diagnostics are available in the kernel debugger for these systems.
segment.target: KDMF Verifier can manage this for you so that KMDF loader diagnostics are available in the kernel debugger for these systems.

segment.source: Verbose logging
segment.target: Verbose logging

segment.source: Enables verbose logging.
segment.target: Enables verbose logging.

segment.source: Memory Pages for Logs
segment.target: Memory Pages for Logs

segment.source: Specifies the number of non-paged pool pages (1-10) to allocate for kernel event trace logs.
segment.target: Specifies the number of non-paged pool pages (1-10) to allocate for kernel event trace logs.

segment.source: The options are Runtime Choice or [110].
segment.target: The options are Runtime Choice or [110].

segment.source: If Runtime Choice, the number of pages depends on the KMDF runtime.
segment.target: If Runtime Choice, the number of pages depends on the KMDF runtime.

segment.source: Starting with KMDF 1.9, the runtime uses more pages when verification is enabled with verbose logging.
segment.target: Starting with KMDF 1.9, the runtime uses more pages when verification is enabled with verbose logging.

segment.source: Fail Memory Allocations
segment.target: Fail Memory Allocations

segment.source: Specifies the number of successful memory allocations allowed before the KMDF verifier starts to fail all memory allocations.
segment.target: Specifies the number of successful memory allocations allowed before the KMDF verifier starts to fail all memory allocations.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Kernel-Mode Driver Framework
